contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> File:AljubarrotaBattle.jpg|A depiction of the Battle of Aljubarrota <-too small at 100px File:Osceola.jpg|Osceola, chief of Seminoles File:Lech walesa prezydent RP.gif|Lech Wałęsa File:Atlantic charter.jpg|Roosevelt and Churchill aboard USS Augusta (CA-31) File:Churchill-Roosevelt-USSAugusta-August1941.jpg|Winston Churchill and Franklin D. Roosevelt File:JohnI-Portugal.jpg|John I of Portugal File:Edison cylinder Lost Chord.ogg|<nowiki>{{DYK Listen|Edison cylinder Lost Chord.ogg|"The Lost Chord", 1888 recording}}</nowiki> File:Cologne Cathedral.jpg|Cologne Cathedral </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- | [[1385]] – Forces under [[John I of Portugal|John I]] defeated the [[Crown of Castile|Castilians]] in the '''[[Battle of Aljubarrota]]''', ending the [[1383–1385 Crisis]] in [[Portugal]]. | needs more footnotes |- | [[1941]] – After a secret meeting aboard warships, [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|British Prime Minister]] [[Winston Churchill]] and [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] issued the '''[[Atlantic Charter]]''', establishing a vision for a post-[[World War II]] world despite the fact that the United States had yet to enter the war. | refimprove |- | [[1947]] – The [[Partition of India]]: The '''[[Dominion of Pakistan]]''' was established, carved out of the two [[Islam|Muslim]]-majority wings in the eastern and northwestern regions of [[British Raj|British India]]. | check [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/August 15]] |- | [[2003]] – A '''[[Northeast blackout of 2003|widescale power blackout]]''' occurred in the [[Northeastern United States]] and in central [[Canada]], affecting an estimated 55 million people. | Tagged with {{tl|refimprove}} |- | [[2006]] – The [[United Nations]] brokered a ceasefire in the '''[[2006 Lebanon War|Lebanon War]]''' between [[Lebanon]] and [[Israel]]. | [[Wikipedia:Non-free content review#File:Hezbollah_Flag.jpg|WP:NFC discussion taking place]] |- | [[2007]] – Four coordinated suicide bomb attacks '''[[2007 Yazidi communities bombings|detonated]]''' in the [[Iraq]]i towns of [[Qahtaniya]] and Jazeera, killing an estimated 796 people and wounding 1,562 others. | outdated |- | [[2009]] – The '''[[Philippine Commission on Women|Magna Carta for Women]]''' became law, allowing further protection for [[women in the Philippines]]. | already featured on [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/January 7|January 7]] |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1880]] – Construction of the '''[[Cologne Cathedral]]''' ''(pictured)''—Germany's [[Tourism in Germany#Landmarks|most visited landmark]]—was completed, 632 years after it had begun. {{*mp}} [[1980]] – '''[[Lech Wałęsa]]''' and colleagues at [[Gdańsk Shipyard]] began [[strike action]]s, which subsequently led to the founding of the [[Solidarity (Polish trade union)|Solidarity]] movement in Poland. {{*mp}} [[1996]] – [[Greek Cypriots|Greek Cypriot]] refugee '''[[Solomos Solomou]]''' was shot to death by Turkish forces while trying to remove a [[flag of Turkey|Turkish flag]] from a flagpole in the [[United Nations Buffer Zone in Cyprus]]. {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[August 14]]''': '''[[Independence Day (Pakistan)|Independence Day]]''' in [[Pakistan]] ([[1947]]) <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em"> {{DYK Listen|Edison cylinder Lost Chord.ogg|"The Lost Chord", 1888 recording}}<!--[[|100x100px]]--> </div> {{*mp}} [[1842]] – [[American Indian Wars]]: American general [[William J. Worth]] declared the '''[[Second Seminole War]]''' to be over. {{*mp}} [[1888]] – A recording of English composer [[Arthur Sullivan]]'s '''''[[The Lost Chord]]''''' ''(audio clip right)'', one of the first recordings of music ever made, was played during a press conference introducing [[Thomas Edison]]'s [[phonograph]]<!--Not bolded, featured on November 29--> in London. {{*mp}} [[1987]] – The [[Australian Federal Police]] raided the compound owned by the '''[[The Family (Australian New Age group)|Santiniketan Park Association]]''' and freed a number of children who had been held there illegally. {{*mp}} [[1994]] – International fugitive '''[[Carlos the Jackal]]''', wanted for a number of terrorist attacks in Europe, was handed over to [[Direction de la surveillance du territoire|French agents]] by Sudanese officials. {{*mp}} [[2005]] – '''[[Helios Airways Flight 522]]''' crashed into a mountain north of [[Marathon, Greece|Marathon]] and [[Varnava]], Greece, killing all 121 people on board. {{*mp}} [[2010]] – The inaugural '''[[Youth Olympic Games]]''' opened in Singapore for athletes between 14 and 18 years old. </li> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=August|Day=14}} <noinclude> </noinclude>
